title: Save column-width of external programs panel
author: WiSchOnline
body_snippet:
<!-- Bug -->
|Detail|Value|
|--:|---|
|Operating system | Windows 10 x64 |
|mRemoteNG version| 1.75.7008  |

How can I keep/save the column-witdh I set in the panel for external programs?

iterations.description: The issue is a valid enhancement request to persist user UI preferences (column widths) for the External Tools panel, improving usability.

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet: Currently those values aren't saved. We can certainly look into adding this though

comments.author: WiSchOnline
comments.snippet:
OK, thanks for the feedback.
If you plan to include that, maybe you can also include the possibility to group items in the external programs... 
Or... you forget the extra panel and include that directly in the main panel, along with the connections, so everything could be in one place. 

Thanks for your work and support!

comments.author: sparerd
comments.snippet: In v1.76 there will be the option to group external tools by first letter in the external tools window. Is something like that what you were thinking? Or grouping in another way?

comments.author: WiSchOnline
comments.snippet:
Maybe good as a start... 

I use the connection-panel to organize all my connections in folders, subfolders etc.
At the moment I'm able to insert a connetion for 'external programs', but I have to configure them in the extra panel.
So, what if you make it possible to insert a connetion with exactly the two additional lines "Filename" and "Parameter" for the external connection instead of 'only' a link to 'external programs'?

In my opinion everything than is at one place an more comfortabl...

comments.author: WiSchOnline
comments.snippet:
Hi.

I checked the beta 1.76 and found the mentioned grouping in the external tools.
If I take care with the names it will help, but still theres no option to open/close single groups in the view like the treeview of the connection allows.

I think, the best will really be, if the external connections will be implemented into the 'normal' connection as suggested above. 
What do you think, could this be a possibility for a future release?

Thanks for your support.

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet:

notes:
AI triage (gemini): The issue is a valid enhancement request to persist user UI preferences (column widths) for the External Tools panel, improving usability.
Approach: Add a `ExtAppsLayout` user setting. In `ExternalToolsWindow`, save the `ObjectListView` state to this setting on close/resize, and restore it on load. Remove or conditionalize the `AutoResizeColumns` call.
